newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: China-Singapore Suzhou Industrial Park signs loan.
newsitem.headline: China-Singapore Suzhou Industrial Park signs loan.

text.p: The China-Singapore Suzhou Industrial Park Development Co Ltd has signed a US$65 million, four-year, transferable loan facility, arranger Citicorp Investment Bank (Singapore) Ltd said on Monday.
The facility is guaranteed by Singapore-Suzhou Township Development Pte Ltd and proceeds will be used to part-finance the development of Districts One and Two of the industrial park.
The park, in China's Jiangsu province, is being set up by Singapore and Chinese parties with backing from their respective governments.

David Lim Tik En, Chief Executive Officer of the borrower, told bankers attending the signing ceremony that to-date, 65 companies from 10 countries had committed to investing more than US$1.7 billion in the park.

"Judging from the type of projects which we have in our project pipeline, we are confident that many more world class multi-national corporations will announce decisions to invest in manufacturing activities (in the park) next year," he said.
